com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

All Known Implementing Classes:
ActivityController.AbstractExceptionHandler, SmartApplication.DefaultExceptionHandler
Enclosing class:
ActivityController
public static interface ActivityController.ExceptionHandler

Defines and splits the handling of various exceptions in a single place. This handler will be invoked once it has been registered.

The exception handler will be invoked at runtime when an exception is thrown and is not handled. You do not need to log the exception, because the ActivityController already takes care of logging it, before invoking the current interface methods.

See Also:
ActivityController.registerExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler)

Method Detail

onBusinessObjectAvailableException

boolean onBusinessObjectAvailableException(android.app.Activity activity,
                                           java.lang.Object component,
                                           LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception)
Is invoked whenever the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() throws an exception.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Parameters:
activity - the activity that issued the exception ; cannot be null
component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
exception - the exception that has been triggered
Returns:
true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

                           java.lang.Object component,

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Returns:

onOtherException

boolean onOtherException(android.app.Activity activity,
                         java.lang.Object component,
                         java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Is invoked whenever an activity implementing LifeCycle throws an unexpected exception, or when an exception is thrown during a AppPublics.GuardedCommand execution.

This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Parameters:
activity - the activity that issued the exception ; cannot be null
component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
throwable - the throwable that has been triggered
Returns:
true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore

onContextException

boolean onContextException(android.content.Context context,
                           java.lang.Object component,
                           java.lang.Throwable throwable)
Is invoked whenever a handled exception is thrown with a non-activity context.

This method serves as a fallback on the framework, in order to handle gracefully exceptions and prevent the application from crashing.

Warning, it is not ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Parameters:
throwable - the throwable that has been triggered
component - the component that issued the exception ; may be null
context - the context that issued the exception
Returns:
true if the handler has actually handled the exception: this indicates to the framework that it does not need to investigate for a further exception handler anymore
